text.text: A well maintained and clean indoor playground with a fun Pororo theme. I've visited twice, once on a Sunday and once on a Monday. I highly recommend visiting on weekdays if possible, as it's much quieter. There's also a charming Loopy themed restaurant inside. Great place for kids to play and explore.

originalText.text: A well maintained and clean indoor playground with a fun Pororo theme. I've visited twice, once on a Sunday and once on a Monday. I highly recommend visiting on weekdays if possible, as it's much quieter. There's also a charming Loopy themed restaurant inside. Great place for kids to play and explore.

text.text:
A very fun space for toddlers ages 2 -8 years old!

My boys enjoyed themselves with the many options to explore creative play.

From the kitchen play area to ball pits to slides and event train rides, camping concepts and more!

I enjoyed the food they have at the cafe! Very generous portions!

The only down downside is the walk to the toilet is very far away.

They only have diaper changing stations available inside. No restrooms for parents.

I appreciate how they have QR codes for entry/exit only for parents to manage the child's activity.

text.text: More adults than kids tripping over each other, the facility is decent but very small and not planned well, the train ride takes up so much space and wastes a lot of precious play area. Such park in JB and batam are way bigger and well organized and not chaotic as this place especially on PH and weekends

Such park in JB and batam are way bigger and well organized and not chaotic as this place especially on PH and weekends

text.text: Places is decent for kids to play with lots playing spots to cater to different age groups. There are even activities time with Pororo and Croc itself but music are too fast pace for younger kids. Bubble time was not start from the timing list stated instead. Down point is the staffs are not even friendly or engaging in anyway even tho they work at kids playground.

text.text:
Been wanting to visit this place with my LO (10 months) but I would advise against it because it was SO overcrowded.

Firstly, we bought the tickets online, but we still had to queue >10 mins together with the walk in queue. Then what’s the point of buying tickets online?

Secondly, 0 crowd control. Yes there were signage to state that there should parental supervision at all times. But the older kids were running here and there with ZERO supervision and there was no staff around. Even at places where the play area is more suitable for SMALLER kids.

Thirdly, which although was the part my LO enjoyed the most but also the most disappointing one — the show. Once again, there was no other staff around, only the poor crew who was donning the costumes (Poporo, Crong and Loopy). NO other staff was there to control the crowd, kids were running up the stage area, pushing the trio around. This is not even about disrupting the show anymore. This is a legit safety issue. The kid just kept on pushing and hitting and weaving in between the characters and even almost fell.

Honestly you can get your money spent better elsewhere.
